summary: The candidate shows limited understanding of core data analysis concepts and requires foundational reinforcement. Basic topics like data types, SQL queries, and Excel functions need review. Advanced areas like statistical modeling and visualization tools are minimal.
areas_of_improvement: Grasp of data manipulation basics (cleaning, filtering, aggregating)
Familiarity with spreadsheet tools and simple visualizations

recommendations.description: Master data types, cleaning techniques, pivot tables, VLOOKUP, and basic charting in Excel.
resources: Excel for Data Analysis (Microsoft Learn) - Modules 1–3
Data Analysis with Excel (LinkedIn Learning) - Beginner Course

recommendations.description: Learn SELECT statements, JOINs, GROUP BY, and filtering with WHERE for database querying.
Understand descriptive statistics, measures of central tendency, and data distributions.

summary: The candidate demonstrates moderate grasp of data analysis basics and can identify key concepts like SQL joins, Python pandas, and basic visualizations. However, advanced querying, statistical inference, and dashboarding remain inconsistent.
strengths: Correct identification of data manipulation techniques and simple queries
Basic understanding of tools like Python for data wrangling
areas_of_improvement: Deeper insight into advanced SQL (window functions, subqueries)
Practical implementation of data pipelines and exploratory data analysis
Structured approach to statistical testing and reporting

recommendations.description: Explore window functions, CTEs, indexing, and performance optimization for complex datasets.
resources: Advanced SQL for Data Scientists (DataCamp) - Full Course

recommendations.description: Master pandas for data cleaning, merging, and analysis; introduce NumPy for numerical computing.
resources: Python for Data Analysis (Wes McKinney) - Chapters 5–8

recommendations.description: Learn Matplotlib/Seaborn for plots, exploratory analysis workflows, and storytelling with data.
resources: Data Visualization with Python (Coursera) - Specialization Course 2

summary: The candidate exhibits strong command of data analysis principles, accurately explaining SQL optimization, Python/R scripting, and advanced visualizations. Knowledge of machine learning integration and big data tools is well-articulated.
strengths: Clear conceptual understanding of end-to-end analysis pipelines
Accurate description of statistical methods and BI tools
Awareness of production considerations like data governance and automation
areas_of_improvement: Advanced integration of ML for predictive analytics and scalable data processing

recommendations.description: Dive into hypothesis testing, regression analysis, A/B testing, and causal inference techniques.
resources: Practical Statistics for Data Scientists (Bruce & Bruce) - Chapters 5–7
Statistical Inference (Coursera by Johns Hopkins) - Course 2

recommendations.description: Master Tableau/Power BI for interactive dashboards, DAX/M for calculations, and data storytelling.
resources: Tableau Desktop Specialist Certification Prep (Tableau Learning)
The Big Book of Dashboards (Yau et al.) - Case Studies

recommendations.description: Explore Spark for distributed processing, scikit-learn for modeling, and ETL pipelines with Airflow.
resources: Introduction to Machine Learning with Python (Mueller & Guido) - Chapters 2–4
